meanings.definition: To make fancier or more elaborate.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys fancifying her room with colorful curtains.
meanings.sent2: The chef is fancifying the dessert with edible flowers.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel fancified its nest with shiny trinkets.
meanings.sent4: Her words fancified the plain story into a magical tale.
meanings.sent5: The artist fancified the dull canvas into a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: The act of adding decorative or ornamental elements.
meanings.sent1: The fancifying of the cake with frosting was impressive.
meanings.sent2: She specializes in the fancifying of wedding venues.
meanings.sent3: The fancifying of the garden with fairy lights created a magical atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The fancifying of the costume with sequins made it sparkle.
meanings.sent5: His job involves the fancifying of store displays with colorful decorations.

meanings.definition: Making something more attractive or appealing.
meanings.sent1: The fancifying flowers in the garden attracted many butterflies.
meanings.sent2: She wore a fancifying dress to the party.
meanings.sent3: The fancifying aroma of the bakery made everyone hungry.
meanings.sent4: His fancifying smile lit up the room.
meanings.sent5: The fancifying design of the website increased user engagement.
